title: Create groomer onboarding page with signup and service management

requirements.text: Create a new frontend page/route for groomer onboarding at /groomer-onboard that allows groomers to sign up and register with the platform

quotes: create a page, where groomers would like to onboard with chewy.com
grromer would lile to sign up

acceptanceCriteria: A new route /groomer-onboard is accessible in the application
The page displays a signup form for groomers
The page uses the existing Chewy blue color palette consistently

requirements.text: Design the groomer onboarding flow to collect groomer details including name, contact information, business information, and any other relevant registration fields

quotes: list their services and other details

acceptanceCriteria: Form fields capture groomer name, email, phone, and business name at minimum
Form validation provides clear feedback for required and invalid fields
The form layout follows the existing scheduler page design patterns

requirements.text: Add a service listing interface within the groomer onboarding flow that allows groomers to add, edit, and remove their service offerings with title, description, and price range

quotes: list their services and other details

acceptanceCriteria: Groomers can add multiple services with title, description, and price range fields
Each service entry can be edited or removed before submission
The service list UI is clear and easy to use

requirements.text: Apply the existing Chewy blue color scheme and typography from the scheduler page consistently across all groomer onboarding UI elements including buttons, form inputs, focus states, and interactive elements

quotes: use the ewarlier color and font s

acceptanceCriteria: All primary buttons use Chewy blue styling matching the scheduler page
Form input focus states use Chewy blue borders and rings
Typography matches the existing scheduler page fonts and hierarchy
The visual theme is consistent with the scheduler flow in both light and dark modes

requirements.text: Create backend methods in the main Motoko actor to handle groomer registration, including storing groomer profile data and their listed services

quotes: create a page, where groomers would like to onboard with chewy.com
list their services and other details

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes a method to register a new groomer with profile details
Backend can store and associate multiple services with a groomer ID
Groomer data persists across canister upgrades using stable storage

requirements.text: Connect the groomer onboarding frontend form to the backend registration methods using React Query, including loading states during submission and success/error feedback after submission

quotes: grromer would lile to sign up, list their services and other details

acceptanceCriteria: Form submission triggers a backend call to register the groomer
Loading spinner or disabled state appears during submission
Success message displays when registration completes successfully
Error message displays with retry option if registration fails

requirements.text: Add navigation from the scheduler page to the groomer onboarding page, and vice versa, so users can easily access both flows
acceptanceCriteria: A clearly labeled link or button on the scheduler page navigates to /groomer-onboard
A link or button on the onboarding page returns to the scheduler
Navigation preserves the existing Chewy blue styling

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui (immutable UI components)
Do not modify frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts or frontend/src/main.tsx
Use the existing Chewy blue color tokens defined in frontend/index.css without changing the theme configuration
nonGoals: Payment processing or Stripe integration for groomer registration fees
Email verification or SMS authentication for groomer accounts
Admin approval workflow for groomer applications
Photo upload functionality for groomer profile pictures
